name: Abstract Art 'Tiny Tapestry' Needlepoint Kit
description:
This is a needlepoint kit. It's simple to make and contains all you need to make a tiny work of art. You will learn how to use tent stitch and how to follow a chart by counting. 

The finished frame is approximately 7 x 6cm.

The kit contains:

1 x golden frame
DMC Perle threads 
Zweigart canvas 
Needle 
Instructions

To start this project you will also need embroidery scissors and sticky tape to finish it. 

KIT RATING: QUITE EASY (Beginner/Intermediate)

© Retrosaria Zoe 2013

name: Sir & Lady Deer 'Tiny Tapestry' Needlepoint Kit
description:
This is a needlepoint kit. It's simple to make and contains all you need to make Sir & Lady Deer picture frames. You will learn how to use tent stitch and how to follow a chart by counting. 

Each finished frame is approximately 5 x 6cm.

The kit contains:

2 x golden frames
DMC Perle threads 
Zweigart canvas 
Needle 
Instructions & chart

To start this project you will also need embroidery scissors and sticky tape to finish it. 

KIT RATING: QUITE EASY (Beginner/Intermediate)

© Retrosaria Zoe 2013

name: Deckchair 'Tiny Tapestry' Needlepoint Kit
description:
Make your own tiny deckchair. You will learn tent stitch and how to follow a chart by counting. This kit is fantastic for those new to tent stitch as it is very simple and contains only straight lines of stitches. 

The finished chair is approximately 11 x 6cm.

The kit contains:

1 x wooden deckchair 
Wool threads 
Zeigart canvas 
Needle 
Instructions

Additionally to the contents of the kit, you will need some sharp scissors.

KIT RATING: EASY (Beginner)

© Retrosaria Zoe 2013

name: Bargello Chair 'Tiny Tapestry' Needlepoint kit
description:
This is a kit to make your own tiny dining chair. You will learn Bargello stitch, the easiest of all needlepoint stitches and it will only take an evening to stitch.

The kit contains:

1 x wooden chair
Perle embroidery threads 
Zeigart canvas
Wadding
Needle 
Instructions

Additionally to the contents of the kit, you will need some scissors, a tiny piece of scrap card and craft glue. 

You can also choose to paint the chair if you wish as shown in the picture. It looks particularly lovely in dark blue, gold, fuscia or bright green. If you decide to paint the chair use ordinary painters acrylic and apply 1 or 2 coats. 

Please note: the chair in the kit has a plain wood finish and is not painted gold. The princess is not included.

KIT RATING: VERY EASY (Beginner)

© Retrosaria Zoe 2013
